meanings.definition: Having a square or rectangular shape resembling a box.
meanings.sent1: The new car model is boxier than the previous one.
meanings.sent2: The boxier design of the building stood out among the round structures.
meanings.sent3: The boxier cake looked like a delicious square treat waiting to be eaten.
meanings.sent4: Her boxier handwriting made it easier to read than the messy cursive.
meanings.sent5: The boxier furniture in the room gave it a modern and sleek feel.

meanings.definition: Tending to be more angular or blocky in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The boxier edges of the puzzle pieces made them easier to fit together.
meanings.sent2: The boxier shapes of the new toys made them more interesting to play with.
meanings.sent3: The boxier clouds in the sky looked like fluffy squares floating above us.
meanings.sent4: His boxier haircut gave him a more defined and structured look.
meanings.sent5: The boxier shadows cast by the streetlights created a unique pattern on the sidewalk.
